repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Add read_utitlities_hook to override how utilities files are accessed.

This change simplifies how Cython can be packaged into a single
file binary executable, where utility files are stored inside the
binary executable as package resource.

comment_data.body: Erm, well â€“ where did this part go?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -336,28 +349,22 @@ def load(cls, util_code_name, from_file=None, **kwargs):
         if not from_file:
             utility_dir = get_utility_dir()
             prefix = util_code_name + '.'
-            try:
-                listing = os.listdir(utility_dir)
-            except OSError:
-                # XXX the code below assumes as 'zipimport.zipimporter' instance
-                # XXX should be easy to generalize, but too lazy right now to write it
-                import zipfile
-                global __loader__
-                loader = __loader__
-                archive = loader.archive
-                with closing(zipfile.ZipFile(archive)) as fileobj:

comment_data.body:
I replaced the entire listdir() logic with checking a predefined set of file name extensions. 

This part is doing a listdir() on a zip file if I understood it correctly, thus it is not needed any more.

commit.message:
Allow overriding the reading of utilities files.

Add set_read_utitlities_hook() to override how utilities
files are accessed.

This change simplifies how Cython can be packaged into a single
file binary executable, where utility files are stored inside the
binary executable as package resource.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

title: Add a hook to change how `utilities` files are read.
